Income Tax Act  (Cap 340, Laws of Uganda)

Notes.Column3: Limit
None. Uganda does not grant a universal personal relief/credit. PAYE is computed using bands with a tax-free monthly threshold of UGX 235,000 (UGX 2,820,000 p.a.)

Notes.Column2: ITA s.19(2)(b); definition of “medical expenses” in s.19
Notes.Column3: Excluded from employment income when the employer reimburses/pays medical expenses. “Medical expenses” includes medical insurance premiums. No statutory shilling cap stated.

Notes.Comprehensive Statutroy Acts & Legal Fra: Business travel & accommodation reimbursement/allowance (in course of duty)
Notes.Column3: Excluded from employment income if incurred or likely to be incurred in performing employment duties. No fixed per-diem cap in the Act.

Notes.Comprehensive Statutroy Acts & Legal Fra: Employer contributions to a retirement fund (resident retirement fund)
Notes.Column3: Excluded from the employee’s employment income (i.e., not taxable to the employee).
A benefit provided to an employee not exceeding UGX 10,000 in a month is treated as non-taxable (exclusion).

Notes.Comprehensive Statutroy Acts & Legal Fra: Meals/refreshments provided on equal terms to all staff, on employer premises
Notes.Column3: Excluded from employment income for the employee; employer’s deduction allowed where the value is included in employment income or provided on equal terms to all workers.

Notes.Comprehensive Statutroy Acts & Legal Fra: Housing / company car / low-interest loans (valuation rules)
Notes.Column3: Taxable benefits with specific valuation rules (e.g., housing “lower of market rent less employee contribution or 15% of emoluments”; car benefit formula (20% × A × B/C) – D; loan benefit = (statutory – actual rate) × principal/12).
